epd_metadata.address: Level 40, Northpoint Tower, 100 Miller St, North Sydney NSW 2060, Australia
epd_metadata.epd_produced_by_address: Level 3, Greenhouse, 180 George Street, Sydney NSW 2000 Australia
epd_metadata.epd_process_certified_by_address: Suite 2600, 101 Marietta St NW, Atlanta, Georgia 30303, USA
epd_metadata.product_group_classification: UN CPC 375 (Articles of concrete, cement and plaster)

product_description.general_use: General use concrete including footpaths, slabs, foundations, normal class concrete

classification.normal_class: Designed for everyday applications such as residential and commercial foundations, driveways and footpaths
classification.special_class: Supplied to major construction projects including high rise buildings, dams, spillways, roads, bridges, public works infrastructure; includes high-strength, high-durability, marine application, post-tensioned, high-pumpability, super workable, piling concrete, architectural off-form finishes and decorative applications

product_description.dangerous_goods_classification: Non-Dangerous Goods according to the Australian Code for the Transport of Dangerous Goods by Road and Rail
product_description.hazardous_substances: None of the products contain substances listed in the Candidate List of Substances of Very High Concern for authorisation
product_description.packaging: Delivered in bulk with no packaging

lca_information.scope: Cradle to gate (modules A1-A3) with options modules A4-A5, modules C1-C4 and module D
lca_information.reference_service_life: Not specified; scope is cradle to delivery

background_data_preferences: Product specific EPDs for cements, admixtures, pigments and fibres
Australian National Life Cycle Inventory Database (AusLCI v1.42) (2023)

allocation.method: Physical allocation based on weight at quarry and m³ of concrete at batching plant; economic allocation used when physical allocation not possible

excluded: Environmental impact from infrastructure, construction, production equipment, and tools not directly consumed
Personnel-related impacts such as transportation to and from work
cut_off_criteria.included: All materials required for manufacturing delivered via trucks and ships without packaging

data_quality.assessment: Good or very good geographic and temporal representativeness
data_quality.background_data_timeliness: All data updated within 10 years as required under PCR 2019:14

system_boundaries.upstream_processes: Extraction, transport and manufacturing of raw materials; generation of electricity for modules A1 and A3
system_boundaries.core_processes: External transportation of materials to core processes; manufacturing of concrete (excluding mixing in truck); treatment of waste and wastewater
system_boundaries.downstream_processes: Distribution of concrete mixes; installation on site; wastage of construction products; transport and treatment of waste at end of life
system_boundaries.other_environmental_information: Environmental benefits from reuse, recovery, and recycling of deconstructed concrete (Module D)

installation.operational_control: No operational control by Holcim; assumptions based on industrial expertise and GCCA tool
installation.activities: Pouring concrete from ready-mix truck and pump; manual finishing; excludes pre-installation activities such as site work and forms

end_of_life.control: No control by Holcim over end-of-life fate

deconstruction.process: Physical drilling and removal using hydraulic excavator

module_references.D: Benefits and loads beyond system boundary (recycling and recovery)

end_of_life.recycling_benefits: Recycled aggregate can replace virgin coarse aggregate depending on product performance requirements

embodied_carbon_reduction_targets.by_2050: All new construction materials net zero

carbonation.description: Natural process of CO2 absorption by concrete over its lifetime, offsetting some emissions
carbonation.note: Carbonation not considered in this EPD and not reflected in results

allocation_approach.fly_ash: Treated as waste material; only transport impacts included
allocation_approach.ground_granulated_blast_furnace_slag: Allocated economically due to significant economic value
allocation_approach.silica_fume: Treated as waste material; only transport impacts included

recycled_materials_handling.background_data: AusLCI LCA database allocation approach adopted as default for secondary data and processes

additional_info.product_group_classification: UN CPC 375 (Articles of concrete, cement and plaster)
references: Australian Life Cycle Inventory Database Initiative (2023)
Department of Climate Change, Energy, the Environment and Water (2023)
disclaimers: Results of environmental impact indicators with high uncertainty or limited experience should be used with care
Ionising radiation indicator excludes effects from nuclear accidents, occupational exposure, and radioactive waste disposal
GWP-GHG (IPCC AR5) excludes biogenic carbon and indirect radiative forcing
Carbonation not included in EPD results

contact_information.address: Level 40/100 Miller St, North Sydney NSW 2060, Australia
